website_summaries.verdict: Long-lasting, durable kayak carrier that will last you a long time.
pros: Powder coated steel construction is designed to last for many years
Heavy-duty straps and tie downs are included
Comes with plush padding to protect the kayak
Built for extreme conditions and constant use
cons: The bolts that come with this item may need to be replaced because they are too long

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Top Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to go along with a GTX Series Rola roof rack on my 2012 MazdaSpeed3. All I can say is wow! This rack looks great and the quality is second to none! You can beat the Amazon price too. The only part of this I wasn't 100% satisfied with that the fore and aft ties only have 1 hook to secure the boat each. Which means you have to tie a safe knot every time, but it's only a minor inconvenience If you have any doubts about this product, don't!
customer_reviews.author: TheOddOcelot

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. <3 them
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I installed them quickly. I am 5'5" and had to use a step stool with my equinox to load my kayak. I don't understand the straps yet... But the way I secured my kayak presented no problems in a drive around town. Never got over 45 mph, though. These j cradles made room so I can haul two kayaks now. :) One cradle came with some rub-wear but that's gonna happen anyway and it doesn't affect its performance. In the pic, I don't have anything tied.
customer_reviews.author: eeviac

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Very similar to my Malone brand j ...
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Very similar to my Malone brand j racks. Slightly less padding but enough. Seems well made. The straps are decent too but a little harder to thread than the Malone. There are better j racks but for the price this is unbeatable and very sufficient. Don't be conned by the cheapo no name ones you have to assemble yourself. They are poorly made. Pay the extra $10-$15 and get these Rola ones. No need to pay extra either. Rola hits the sweet spot between affordable and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Pfryde

customer_reviews.title: My first J hook
customer_reviews.text: I already have a Rola rack, so this screws right on.. takes about 5 minutes to screw on both of them firmly... the nice thing is it's also as easy to take off! just twist the knobs to unscrew it off.. only five minutes too.. So I don't have to leave it on top all the time exposed to the elements.. I really like that! It carried my 14.5 feet long Dagger Stratos just fine without any issues. The included cam straps are quality straps. the bow and stern S hook and rope worked fine with the tieoff points on my KIA Soul 2014. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonhide

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, budget kayak carrier
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. I have two sets one for each side of my vehicle. It comes already assembled and all you do is unscrew the bottom plates and screw them on to your vehicle's cross bars. The straps are okay but not thick enough in my opinion so I use an additional ratchet strap on the middle and haven't had any issues. My set up is: Two sets of Rola J Rack The middle carrier is a rhino rack and they sit on a Yakima cross bar.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: This kayak carrier works just as expected. I haven't tried a lot out there or anything--I just bought this one because the reviews were good and it looked like it was made well. I've used it several times and I'm happy with it. Pay attention to the shape of the connection to your cross bars to make sure it will fit properly. My bars are only 30 inches apart and my kayak is 17 feet long, so I definitely had to use connection points at the end (which I was able to do using my car's tow hooks).
customer_reviews.author: this_guy

customer_reviews.title: I was very pleasantly surprised when I received these J hooks. Buy them.
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me, you've been looking at the "nice" ones thinking the price was absurdly expensive and then at the cheapo ones thinking that that was way too cheap. For those of you out there like that, this is the set. You can't beat it. Especially not for this money. Easily as nice as the big name brands at a fraction of the cost. They are really well constructed. I have no doubts that they will outlast the vehicle that I have them mounted on.
customer_reviews.author: RickyVaughn

customer_reviews.title: Strong rack.
customer_reviews.text: Strong rack, fit nicely on my 1999 Yukon factory rack. Had to cut down the mounting bolts by 1/2" with a hacksaw, because my bars are pretty close to the roof. The padding appears to be made of pretty good material, but I'm sure like any foam it will break down in the sun. When it does, I'll get some 1/2" pipe insulation at some depot. 10' Kayak was rock steady when strapped on.
customer_reviews.author: Phil B

customer_reviews.title: Ascend 12t
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint from this so far is I wish you could adjust the foam padding. My kayak doesn't sit on my of the padding so I had to find a alternative. Other than that it does it's job well, especially when tied down. I used this for my Ascend 12t. I wouldn't go any bigger than that kayak with this though. I have only gone 45 mph with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio G.

customer_reviews.title: If fits nicely on my 2012 BMW 335xi Coupe's BMW factory racks
customer_reviews.text: These J Style Kayak Carriers are basically the same I see whether they are Thule, Yakima, Rola etc. So I chose Rola because they are a reputable brand and was almost half the price. If fits nicely on my 2012 BMW 335xi Coupe's BMW factory racks. I was worried it might not fit since BMW racks are rather round and large but it fit nicely. I strongly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Adani Chiamatto

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully
customer_reviews.text: These work very well. It includes everything you need to secure a boat on top of your vehicle...except for the crossbars that they get mounted to. Very easy and quick to put on and take off the vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: love this
customer_reviews.text: These racks are great. I have 2 sets on my crosstrek and they are easy to put on and off. The buckles have safety covers which I love since I throw them over my car. No dings. My friend got hers at Costco and they didn't have the rubber jackets that slide over the buckles. I'm a 5"5" older woman and these work well for me. great value for the money. My Kayak is secure.
customer_reviews.author: Christy S.

customer_reviews.title: Great rack!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband's car, and put the kayak on it for the fist time yesterday. It doesn't have instruction, but a QR code you can scan to get them. It is fairly straight forward, and you don't even have to put the racks together - just attach them to your car. What is most impressive to me is the nice rubber covers for the metal clips. Helps keep your car safe from dings and scratches. I highly recommend this rack - you won't be sorry for spending a few extra bucks!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: I put these on a '12 4Runner with factory rails ...
customer_reviews.text: I put these on a '12 4Runner with factory rails. Had to run to Lowes to pick up new bolts, M8x50mm so that they wouldn't rub the roof. Construction seems strong, I put it on the truck in 16* F as I am running out tomorrow to pick up a Kayak. Can't complain about the ease of assembly. Product seems tight! Looking forward to getting it loaded up.
customer_reviews.author: K.C.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I don't think you can beat the quality for the price and everything included with the purchase! I bought 2 pair of these for a 16 hour round trip mostly on highway (85 mph max speed, 75 mph average for the trip). I used the straps and bow/stern tie-downs along with a ratchet strap of my own for extra precaution and safety given th he high speeds I'd be traveling at. Everything performed great during the trip and they've been used many times since for much shorter trips close to home.
customer_reviews.author: J. Blair

customer_reviews.title: For the price, you can’t beat it!
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to J hooks there are high quality brands with high quality prices (Thule & Yakima) and lots of cheaply made, low quality products. Rola is an interesting option. It is high quality construction but half the price of the Thule and Yakima units.
customer_reviews.author: N. Wilk

customer_reviews.title: Great yak racks
customer_reviews.text: These kayak racks are solid and easy to install and then remove when roof clearance is needed when not transporting your kayaks. The yaks ride great. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Spinmaster

customer_reviews.title: Happy with kayak rack purchase
customer_reviews.text: These work great. My husband installed them in less than 30 minutes and we were on our way. These were very good for the price. I was going to buy some that were less money but in the end we are happy with these kayak carriers. With the roof rack that we have it was high enough off the roof of the car that we had no problems with the screw length.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Great For Outbacks!
customer_reviews.text: Love these for my 2019 Outback. They fit the factory-integrated crossbars well and haven't had to adjust/tighten them after the first carry. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: sardog10

customer_reviews.title: Not for every kayak
customer_reviews.text: If you have wide kayak this product might not be for you. We tried it with a cheap two-person standup kayak and the forces on the highway made it slip around. That was probably for the best since at least it wasn't ripped off our rack on the highway. On the way home from the beach we opted to tie it to the roof rack and used this product for lateral stability. It worked well that way.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Good Rack for the price
customer_reviews.text: The racks are well made, sturdy and come with sufficient straps. One annoyance, no instructions - not that it's not fairly obvious, but the strapping reccomendation you have to go online. It's just a bit annoying. Now the one think that i will say. My kayaks are a bit thicker. They don't really seat down into the rack like it's supposed to, therefore not quite as stable. Still a good sturdy rack for the price, but a couple issues. Still think it will work.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen K.

customer_reviews.title: ... with these over cheaper ones due to reviews of poor quality. Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Decided to go with these over cheaper ones due to reviews of poor quality. Very happy with my purchase. Out of the box ready to set up and supplied with heavy duty straps. Would have been nice to have directions on how to safely secure kayak to holder but a simple google search solved that. Drove at speeds close to 70 mph and kept an eye on it thru the sunroof. I didn't see any abnormal shaking. Looks official too, 5 stars would recommend
customer_reviews.author: RYNHLL

customer_reviews.title: One to try out, now buying another!
customer_reviews.text: Overall great carrier, in quality and looks. Bought one to try out and bought a second for the other kayak.
customer_reviews.author: DrinknKnowthings21

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. Fits my round Yakima bars, but I did put athletic tape on the bars so the racks are less likely to spin. Worked perfectly for my sit-on-top fishing kayak.
customer_reviews.author: B in Redding

customer_reviews.title: Pros- great quality, inexpensive (the most important thing to me
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my kayaks on a yakima roof rack system. Pros- great quality, inexpensive (the most important thing to me.. wasnt crazy about spending 200 on yakima carriers),simple to install. My only con would be the straps. They must be cut to size. All in all, i would highly recommend these unless you're a brand whore
customer_reviews.author: Michael E Christman

customer_reviews.title: Arrived scratched and rusted.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered two pair so we could carry our two kayaks on our Tahoe. Right out of the package one set is badly scratched and rusted. Annoyed. We're just going to buy some black Rustoleum to spray on the two damaged ones, but we shouldn't have to.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great racks for the price - good option versus name brands!
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research before settling on these. The build quality is on par with the name brand Yakima and Thule J hooks and mounted perfectly on my Honda Element factory crossbars. Will be ordering another set here real soon!
customer_reviews.author: Ray Ameller

customer_reviews.title: They're perfect. Work great on my Jeep to hold my ...
customer_reviews.text: They're perfect. Work great on my Jeep to hold my fishing kayak securely. Saved me $80.00 compared to a top selling brand.
customer_reviews.author: krs

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, sturdy j mount at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Jr

customer_reviews.title: Not actually 1-4 month wait time, great quality!
customer_reviews.text: First note** I ordered 2 sets of these when it said 1 - 4 months wait time. I got them in LESS THAN A WEEK! This may not be the case every time but I was super happy about it. These are great! Do not get the cheap J bars as they require a wrench to install and remove on crossbars. I bought this set specifically because they attach with wing-nuts BY HAND. I have been on two 200mi trips with them and they have stayed very secure. Included straps are nice and they also include sleeves for the buckle as to not scratch your kayak.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Very nice protective pads for almost half the price of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice protective pads for almost half the price of the more pricey models. Holds the kayak solidly, and have traveled on the interstate with no problems going 70 miles per hour. Great Purchase
customer_reviews.author: Dave H.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: These are great racks for the price. Easy to install and work fine with my roof racks. My only complaint was that there weren't any directions included. I had to google how to use a J rack to properly secure my kayak and how to tie it down properly.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install/uninstall on roof rack. Supports kayaks as expected. Straps are well made and do not loosen during transport Have used three times since received driving more than 20 miles one way at highway speeds (50-65 mph)
customer_reviews.author: Susie D.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy cradles
customer_reviews.text: Great racks! Kayaks fit perfectly and it fits the bar I bought from the same company. Although I did buy different straps to hook them in
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome racks, work with yakima roundbars!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical at first about these racks mounting to a yakima round bar and holding. To my surprise, once tightened down they barely move. (I did have to put an additional rubber strip on the underside of the clamp). Overall, these racks seem extremely durable and even fit my widest kayak. Great buy and will buy again if I need another set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough for a  Feelfree kayak
customer_reviews.text: Nice product packaged well but would not accommodate a feelfree lure kayak. To narrow. returned
customer_reviews.author: J. Whitely

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good quality
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Had to change the screws to attached the bar bracket because they were too long.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Alcalde

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets of these! I now have racks on racks.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Took a minute to figure out. The only complain is the lack of instructions.
customer_reviews.author: junglsmasif

customer_reviews.title: it was nice to finally find a set of J hooks that ...
customer_reviews.text: it was nice to finally find a set of J hooks that would fit my rola rack. it was really hard to find these. not sure why.
customer_reviews.author: Nick B.

customer_reviews.title: Canoe canoe?
customer_reviews.text: Work like a charm and easy to install. Awesome value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought some shorter ones and it works great. Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Would have given them 5 stars but the bolts are too long for a standard crossbar. Bought some shorter ones and it works great. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These things work great, especially for the slimmer kayaks
customer_reviews.text: These things work great, especially for the slimmer kayaks, I have 3 sets on my Subaru holding a bevvy of necky kayaks including a double hulled gannet II. So ya, they are easy to install. I did have to trim one bolt because it touched the sheet metal when attached to the roof rack, but that was a quick and easy hack saw fix. Better too long that too short, better to have it and not need it than need it and not have it. I really do like these things in their price point especially.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Yoder

customer_reviews.title: it supported my kayaks nicely.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful with the screws, it scratched the top of my car but other than that, it supported my kayaks nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great roof rack kayak holder, very sturdy for the low price.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, quality straps
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly on my Rola truck rack. Easy installation, quality straps.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S

customer_reviews.title: As good as the major guys but much less expensive
customer_reviews.text: High quality product. As good as the major guys but much less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: ... these J-racks at all - the quality seemed very good, and all the included hardware was top notch
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to knock these J-racks at all - the quality seemed very good, and all the included hardware was top notch. Unfortunately, they did not fit our kayaks as they were too narrow. So for anyone looking to order these, if yours are a little thick like ours, they may not work out. For reference, we have a pair of SunDolphin 10SS sit-on kayaks.
customer_reviews.author: BiggsTheGoalie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Great quality at a good price. The warranty and powder coating is what sold me on these. I haul 2 different types of kayaks, 1 fishing and 1 basic Dolphin kayak. Both fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Fits like a charm, great quality and sturdy clamps, would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Fabian E. Garren

customer_reviews.title: Roof paint damage from bolts.
customer_reviews.text: The product works fine except that the bolts that it comes with to attach the J to the carrier are too long. They stick out with just a few millimeters to spare from the roof. I have 2 small kayaks (35 lbs each) placed on 2 sets of Js. That weight is enough to push the bolts down and rest on the roof. When you place the kayak on the J, the weight is just enough to make contact with the roof.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with my rola roof rack. my fishing ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with my rola roof rack. my fishing kayak sits snug in this set up once tightened down.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Bogue

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. I think my 10' kayak will travel well.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: They were sturdy and stay put
customer_reviews.text: Used these to travel east with two kyacks. They were sturdy and stay put. We used lock washers to keep the knobs from loosening up. The bottom bar is curved but did ok with our cross bars that were streight on the bottom. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: U. B.

customer_reviews.title: and was very pleased. It is a simple but well made product
customer_reviews.text: In looking for a kayak rack, I really wanted to spend less than $100. I came across this, and it had very few reviews. I was nervous, but a bit of research told me the company was reputable but not big in the USA. I took a shot on it, and was very pleased. It is a simple but well made product. Everything feels sturdy and well manufactured. All the components were packed neatly. It fit great on my 2015 Subaru Outback.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Batten

customer_reviews.title: ROLA J rack A++
customer_reviews.text: Needed a set of these and needed them really quick. All my friends have the Thule brand which is great but I was not willing to spend that kind of money. Then I stumbled upon these. Was nervous since when I purchased there were zero reviews but took a shot. Got in 2 days with prime so I could haul my kayak to camp. 60 bucks well spent! Solid and good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Jordo

customer_reviews.title: The build quality is good - stainless bolts and sturdy tubing
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is good - stainless bolts and sturdy tubing. Unfortunately, the provided bolts are a full 3 inches long and this left them uncomfortably close the the roof when used with factory cross-rails on my 4Runner. I wasn't comfortable with letting them 'tickle' the roof so I tried getting shorter 5/16 stainless bolts from Lowe's. Unfortunately, the threads are tighter together on these and that didn't work either. Returning product. I think Rola should send these with both 2 inch and 3 inch bolts to accommodate the different rack heights - I'd gladly have spent the extra $5 in hardware. Back to shopping for kayak racks.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for my roof rack.
customer_reviews.text: Came assembled and we're relatively easy to install, however the bolts that attach the j-hooks to my roof rack are too long. I'll need to get different bolts, or cut them a bit shorter.
customer_reviews.author: jfe - mo

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, that was the most insanely fast shipping ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, that was the most insanely fast shipping I've ever seen. I ordered around noon Friday, it was at my doorstep by noon Saturday, for non-prime free shipping, that's insane. Good price, good quality, lightning fast shipping, would highly recommend the product and company. A+++
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Moore

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit Nola cross bars well and no instructions. Sent back!!!
customer_reviews.text: These do not sit flush on the NOLA cross bars. The Nola cross bars have an arch to them and even know these are NOLA as well they do not have the same arch, so they sway to one side or another. Going back! No instructions in the box so I contacted the seller. They could not provide and said I need to contact the manufacturer. They are the seller of a product that they don't provide instruction manual. Shame on you! I'm not going to search to find it. I paid for the product and it should have been in the box. Now I'm just going to return it on your dime!!
customer_reviews.author: PHAC

customer_reviews.title: The distance between the short and tall bars are too ...
customer_reviews.text: The distance between the short and tall bars are too close so you can't fit a kayak in these. Unfortunately, by the time I mounted them to try them out I was past the 30 day return window so I'm going to try to bend them further open somehow so that I don't have to throw them away. Spend a little more money and buy ones that work as I have a fairly narrow kayak and it won't fit in these carriers so I doubt many kayaks will.
customer_reviews.author: Dane Hauser

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: So far it has done well. I liked the fact it came full assembled. I did have to get shorter bolts to clear the roof of my Tahoe and I used ratcheting straps just as a precaution. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Maybe it was a defect
customer_reviews.text: Had this mounted on Yakima railgrabs. One of the plates bent whole transporting a field n stream kayak. This caused one of the racks to slide a little, good thing I stopped to take a look and re-tighten it. Originally asked for a replacement but forget it now. I've had better peace of mind transporting the yak upside down strapped down.
customer_reviews.author: Binh_there

customer_reviews.title: Must have crossbars to attach.
customer_reviews.text: Fairly decent product. Wasn't aware that crossbars were needed. Did not work on side bars. Good value for price
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J. Cline

customer_reviews.title: good luck. It is SO HARD to hoist the ...
customer_reviews.text: If you have an SUV.....good luck. It is SO HARD to hoist the kayaks up there alone, or even with someone. We have to use a step-ladder and a large extendable grabber to fling the straps around. Also, during our first use, the foam padding ripped off. Overall, just not that user-friendly.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great and easy carrier! Bolted it on, strapped the kayak down and drove 13 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

product_meta.title: ROLA (59912) J Style Kayak Carrier Roof Rack
product_meta.description: The access point is calling and ROLA will get you there. We understand how important your kayak is to you, which is why ROLA put so much thought and energy into offering a solid, dependable, and undeniably attractive solution for getting your vessel to its destination. Designed to outlive the very prized-possessions that it holds onto, the ROLA J-Rac Kayak Carrier is crafted using high strength, powder coated steel and rust resistant hardware, proving it's in it for the long haul. The foam pads cradle and protect your boat, making it feel loved and appreciated during transport. The universal hardware works with ROLA and most other crossbars. And because we know how precious your cargo is, the J-Rac Kayak Carrier is equipped with premium heavy-duty straps and bow/stern tie-downs for maximum staying power. Keeping true to ROLA's rich Aussie roots, the J-Rac is Outback tested and Outdoors approved. So whether it's a sit-on-top, a single or tandem-whatever your vessel, let ROLA hold it for you. ROLA - Built for Extremes, Designed for Everyday Life.
feature_bullets: Robust capacity - perfect for sit-on-tops, singles, tandems or whatever your "yak" of choice
High strength powder coated steel construction for superior boat security year after year, season after season
Foam pads cradle and protect your watercraft during transport
Universal hardware works with ROLA and most other crossbars
Premium heavy-duty straps and bow/stern tie-downs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars145 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
